column3: The total time difference between the current competitor and the leader of the race
The time difference between the current competitor and the competitor ahead of them

Refers to the time difference between the current lap's Sector 1 time and the competitor's personal best time for that same sector. 
Positive Value usually means the current sector time was slower than the personal best for that sector.
A specific, often cumulative or detailed, format of the Sector 1 lap time.

It indicates whether a car crossed the main start/finish line while it was officially entering or within the pit lane.
It said B(Blank) means that The competitor completed that lap by driving across the timing line on the main racing track.
This is a representation of time as the total number of seconds that have elapsed since a fixed reference point
